thread.title: FEMA Gives Arkansas $574K for Flood Mapping
thread.title_full: FEMA Gives Arkansas $574K for Flood Mapping

title: FEMA Gives Arkansas $574K for Flood Mapping
text:
FEMA Gives Arkansas $574K for Flood Mapping 
by Arkansas Business Staff on Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 11:10 am 
A program by the Federal Emergency Management Agency has given more than $1.7 million to agencies in Arkansas, Louisiana, New Mexico and Oklahoma to maintain up-to-date flood hazard maps and other flood hazard information. 
These grants are made possible by FEMA's Cooperating Technical Partners program. 
The cities and agencies that received the grants are: The Arkansas Natural Resources Commission - $573,804 The Louisiana Department of Transportation and Development - $75,000 The Oklahoma Department of Emergency Management - $515,000 The University of New Mexico - $556,875 The Water Institute of the Gulf in Louisiana - $25,000 
Fundable activities of the CTP program include program management, base map acquisition, scoping and outreach.
